Objects.Object: No entry point specified. Using default connectivity diagnose experience

Detail.name: Root Cause Count
Detail.Data: The following number of root causes were found.

Objects.Object: ID:{22876540-9123-2765-1989-A27A4E819008} Description:DHCP is not enabled for "Local Area Connection* 8"

Object.Property: Windows can detect the correct network settings for you.
DHCP is not enabled for "Local Area Connection* 8"

Detail.name: Script Error
Detail.Data: An error written by a cmdlet into the PowerShell error stream

Detail.name: Script Error
Detail.Data: An error written by a cmdlet into the PowerShell error stream

<?xml version="1.0"?> <Rootcauses Version="1.0"><Rootcause><ID>{BAA4467D-8F57-4739-879B-2CF78298177B}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>The default gateway is not available</Name><Description>The default gateway is a device that connects a local network or computer to the Internet. A broadband modem or router is usually the default gateway.</Description></DisplayInformation><Status>Not Checked</Status><Verifiable>true</Verifiable><Resolutions><Resolution><ID>{07d37f7b-fa5e-4443-bda7-ab107b29afb9}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>Reset the "%InterfaceName%" adapter</Name><Description>This can sometimes resolve an intermittent problem.</Description></DisplayInformation><RequiresConsent>false</RequiresConsent><Script><RequiresElevation>false</RequiresElevation><RequiresInteractivity>false</RequiresInteractivity></Script><ExtensionPoint> <PhysicallyLoggedOnUser/> </ExtensionPoint> </Resolution><Resolution><ID>{9513cc1c-4a26-4cb8-bf89-0a82129bd105}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>Investigate router or broadband modem issues</Name><Description>If you're connected to a hotspot or domain network, contact the network administrator. Otherwise: 1. Unplug or turn off the device. 2. After all the lights on the device are off, wait at least 10 seconds. 3. Turn the device on or plug it back into the power outlet. To restart a router or modem that has a built-in battery, press and quickly release the Reset button.</Description></DisplayInformation><RequiresConsent>false</RequiresConsent><Script><RequiresElevation>false</RequiresElevation><RequiresInteractivity>true</RequiresInteractivity></Script><ExtensionPoint/> </Resolution></Resolutions><Parameters><Parameter><Name>SBSData</Name><Value/></Parameter><Parameter><Name>Keywords</Name><Value>Network</Value></Parameter></Parameters><ExtensionPoint> <SecurityBoundarySafe>%SBSData%</SecurityBoundarySafe> </ExtensionPoint> </Rootcause><Rootcause><ID>{271FFA7D-FD14-4CD5-8C8F-974956ED2D92}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>The default gateway is not available</Name><Description>The default gateway is a device that connects a local network or computer to the Internet. Checked</Status><Verifiable>true</Verifiable><Resolutions><Resolution><ID>{07d37f7b-fa5e-4443-bda7-ab107b29afb9}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>Reset the "%InterfaceName%" adapter</Name><Description>This can sometimes resolve an intermittent problem.</Description></DisplayInformation><RequiresConsent>false</RequiresConsent><Script><RequiresElevation>false</RequiresElevation><RequiresInteractivity>false</RequiresInteractivity></Script><ExtensionPoint> <PhysicallyLoggedOnUser/> </ExtensionPoint> </Resolution><Resolution><ID>{9513cc1c-4a26-4cb8-bf89-0a82129bd105}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>Investigate router or broadband modem issues</Name><Description>If you're connected to a hotspot or domain network, contact the network administrator. Otherwise: 1. Unplug or turn off the device. 2. After all the lights on the device are off, wait at least 10 seconds. 3. Turn the device on or plug it back into the power outlet. To restart a router or modem that has a built-in battery, press and quickly release the Reset button.</Description></DisplayInformation><RequiresConsent>false</RequiresConsent><Script><RequiresElevation>false</RequiresElevation><RequiresInteractivity>true</RequiresInteractivity></Script><ExtensionPoint/> </Resolution></Resolutions><Parameters><Parameter><Name>SBSData</Name><Value/></Parameter><Parameter><Name>Keywords</Name><Value>Network</Value></Parameter></Parameters><ExtensionPoint> <SecurityBoundarySafe>%SBSData%</SecurityBoundarySafe> </ExtensionPoint> </Rootcause><Rootcause><ID>{1C0B07EF-01C8-4d1f-B137-1C078BB4383C}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>Problem with wireless adapter or access point</Name><Description></Description></DisplayInformation><Status>Not Checked</Status><Verifiable>true</Verifiable><Resolutions><Resolution><ID>{07d37f7b-fa5e-4443-bda7-ab107b29afb9}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>Reset the wireless adapter</Name><Description></Description></DisplayInformation><RequiresConsent>false</RequiresConsent><Script><RequiresElevation>false</RequiresElevation><RequiresInteractivity>false</RequiresInteractivity></Script><ExtensionPoint> <PhysicallyLoggedOnUser/> </ExtensionPoint> </Resolution><Resolution><ID>{9513cc1c-4a26-4cb8-bf89-0a82129bd105}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>Investigate router or access point issues</Name><Description>If you're connected to a hotspot or domain network, contact the network administrator. Otherwise: 1. Unplug or turn off the device. 2. After all the lights on the device are off, wait at least 10 seconds. 3. Turn the device back on or plug it back into the power outlet. To restart a router or access point that has a built-in battery, press and quickly release the Reset button.</Description></DisplayInformation><RequiresConsent>false</RequiresConsent><Script><RequiresElevation>false</RequiresElevation><RequiresInteractivity>true</RequiresInteractivity></Script><ExtensionPoint/> </Resolution></Resolutions><Parameters><Parameter><Name>SBSData</Name><Value/></Parameter><Parameter><Name>Keywords</Name><Value>Network</Value></Parameter></Parameters><ExtensionPoint> <SecurityBoundarySafe>%SBSData%</SecurityBoundarySafe> </ExtensionPoint> </Rootcause><Rootcause><ID>{46EC1E49-CA70-4561-9AB7-009F6B1B3709}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>There might be a problem with the driver for the %InterfaceName% adapter</Name><Description>Windows couldn't automatically bind the IP protocol stack to the network adapter.</Description></DisplayInformation><Status>Not Checked</Status><Verifiable>true</Verifiable><Resolutions><Resolution><ID>{4406F2CC-9CBD-4098-A03A-E5C9810E4895}</ID><DisplayInformation><Name>Set up the %FriendlyInterfaceName% adapter</Name><Description>Set up the network adapter to communicate with this network.
